title: LINE Command
content:
Command: LINE
Shortcut: L

Used to draw straight line segments in drawings.

Steps:
1. Type L and press Enter
2. Specify the first point
3. Specify the next point
4. Press Enter to finish

title: CIRCLE Command
content:
Command: CIRCLE
Shortcut: C

Used to draw circles using different methods.

Steps:
1. Type C and press Enter
2. Specify center point
3. Enter radius or diameter
4. Press Enter to complete

title: OFFSET Command
content:
Command: OFFSET
Shortcut: O

Used to create parallel copies of objects at a fixed distance.

Steps:
1. Type O and press Enter
2. Enter offset distance
3. Select the object
4. Click the side to offset

title: TRIM Command
content:
Command: TRIM
Shortcut: TR

Used to remove unwanted portions of objects.

Steps:
1. Type TR and press Enter
2. Select cutting edges
3. Press Enter
4. Click parts to remove

title: EXTEND Command
content:
Command: EXTEND
Shortcut: EX

Used to extend objects to meet boundary edges.

Steps:
1. Type EX and press Enter
2. Select boundary edges
3. Press Enter
4. Select objects to extend

title: MOVE Command
content:
Command: MOVE
Shortcut: M

Used to move objects from one place to another.

Steps:
1. Type M and press Enter
2. Select objects
3. Specify base point
4. Specify destination point

title: COPY Command
content:
Command: COPY
Shortcut: CO

Used to create duplicate objects.

Steps:
1. Type CO and press Enter
2. Select objects
3. Specify base point
4. Specify second point

title: ROTATE Command
content:
Command: ROTATE
Shortcut: RO

Used to rotate objects around a base point.

Steps:
1. Type RO and press Enter
2. Select objects
3. Specify base point
4. Enter rotation angle

title: SCALE Command
content:
Command: SCALE
Shortcut: SC

Used to resize objects proportionally.

Steps:
1. Type SC and press Enter
2. Select objects
3. Specify base point
4. Enter scale factor

title: MIRROR Command
content:
Command: MIRROR
Shortcut: MI

Used to create mirrored copies of objects.

Steps:
1. Type MI and press Enter
2. Select objects
3. Specify first mirror line point
4. Specify second mirror line point

title: FILLET Command
content:
Command: FILLET
Shortcut: F

Used to round or connect corners between objects.

Steps:
1. Type F and press Enter
2. Set radius if needed
3. Select first object
4. Select second object

title: CHAMFER Command
content:
Command: CHAMFER
Shortcut: CHA

Used to create beveled edges between objects.

Steps:
1. Type CHA and press Enter
2. Set chamfer distances
3. Select first object
4. Select second object

title: ARRAY Command
content:
Command: ARRAY
Shortcut: AR

Used to create multiple copies in patterns.

Steps:
1. Type AR and press Enter
2. Select object
3. Choose array type
4. Set rows and columns

title: HATCH Command
content:
Command: HATCH
Shortcut: H

Used to fill enclosed areas with patterns.

Steps:
1. Type H and press Enter
2. Select hatch pattern
3. Click inside boundary
4. Press Enter

title: LAYER Command
content:
Command: LAYER
Shortcut: LA

Used to manage layers in a drawing.

Steps:
1. Type LA and press Enter
2. Create or select layer
3. Set color or line type
4. Make layer current
